sentence.Network_en: She has gone to bed and had a dose of castor oil.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent. (in sense 2): originally a variant of caster, in the general sense 'something that casts'
late Middle English (in the sense 'beaver'): from Old French or Latin, from Greek kastōr

entry.tran: (安装在家具底部的)脚轮，滚轮
entry.def: Castors are small wheels fitted to a piece of furniture so that it can be moved more easily.

means.word_mean: 1. a shaker with a perforated top for sprinkling powdered sugar
2. a pivoting roller attached to the bottom of furniture or trucks or portable machines to make them movable
3. a hat made of beaver fur or similar material
